item.title: Extreme Programming 20 years later
item.description:
Youtube Link

Speaker

Kent Beck, Facebook Advisor Programmer

Thoughts

I hardly can comment on Extreme Programming for now, but the ideas that Kent is telling are no much distant from common sense in a way.

For me, is very plausible that he came with all the basics for this framework only by making stuff up. After awhile, he noticed that everything was well funded in experience reports.

Quotes

Extreme Programming has three weeks interaction with stories and testing

If you have a dump idea, figure out the most cheap way to try it out. They are always worth trying

I am the owner of my code and I am responsible for its quality and performance

Extreme Programming matches the behavior of programmers in the wild

Recomendations

  1. I may need to experiment Smalltalk for a while
  2. Always be informed by data

Books

  1. Toyota Production System: Beyond Large-Scale Production
  2. Extreme Programming Explained
